item.title: JB Hi-Fi lifts guidance amid sales surge
item.description: JB Hi-Fi has bumped up its full-year profit guidance following a surge in sales since March as customers forced to work from home increase demand for home appliances and technology products.

item.title: Pressure grows for anti-corruption monitor
item.description: The government has again gagged debate on a federal anti-corruption bill as it blames the coronavirus pandemic for delays in establishing the watchdog.

item.title: Alliance raising $122m for new planes
item.description: Alliance Aviation is seeking to raise up to $121.9 million to buy more jet aircraft to service additional charter customers amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: HBO Max pulls Gone with the Wind
item.description: HBO Max says Gone with the Wind will eventually return to the platform with a discussion about its historical context and a denouncement of its racist depictions.

item.title: Ardern supreme as poll countdown begins
item.description: An unusual thing happened to Jacinda Ardern on Friday night.

item.title: Second virus wave would cost $25 billion
item.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison is using the enormous economic cost of a second wave of coronavirus to persuade protesters not to hold another series of anti-racism rallies.

item.title: Pelosi urges Confederate statues removed
item.description: US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi has urged Congress to immediately take steps to remove from the US Capitol 11 statues representing Confederate leaders and soldiers from the Civil War.

item.title: Disney eyes July reopening in California
item.description: Walt Disney Co plans to reopen the Disneyland Park and Disney California Adventure park on July 17, pending approval from state and local authorities.

item.title: US city bars riot unit at peaceful rallies
item.description: The mayor of Buffalo, New York, has ordered that a new police unit without military gear and trained in civil rights handle peaceful demonstrations after a riot unit was involved in the injury of a 75-year-old protester.

item.title: White House police reforms on the way
item.description: The White House says it is putting the finishing touches on proposals to reform the police following George Floyd's killing while in police custody, but warned that reducing immunity for officers was a non-starter.
